A0735 aqu
A- v . i., aux., and copul. To be (not all forms of this verb are used; see examples also under abacu, abasu, atal-a, axui, azu, azuγu ). --zi. Past tense used instead of azuγu (q. v. ). bi ene γazar - -suγai Let me stay at this place. bui --muit. There is. kylijen --γsaγar edyr udaba. [I] have been waiting for many days. sain saγatazu --mui uu? How are you? lit,: are you living well ?) tegyn y - -γsan γazar. The place where he had been. tein --xul-a. If it is or were so. tende - -tuγai. [Let him] be there ! tere oruzu irekyi dy bi saγuzu --bai. When he came in I was sitting.

A1296 aba ав ABA 2 n. Chase, hunt, battue. -- gøryge, Hunting. -- kiky. To go hunting. -- talbixu. To begin a hunt; to encircle the game on a battue. -- taraxu. The hunters spread out for the battue -- xurljaxu. To call a finish to a hunt. -- zarlaxu. To invite or call for a hunt. ang -- Hunting, trapping.

A1565 abqu авах AB- v, t. a) To take, grasp, get hold of. b) To receive, obtain, gain, procure, acquire; to collect (as taxes); to buy; . to absorb, draw in; to adopt; to conceive. c) To remove, take off. d) As an auxiliary verb -preceded by imperfect or modal converbs describes the action as performance in the interest, on behalf, at the wish, or in the direction of the subject. e) As an auxiliary verb preceded by the perfect converb describes the action as momentary. f) The modal and perfect converbs of this verb preceded by the ablative case have the meaning of "beginning with, from. Since” --cu ireky. To bring. --cu jabuxu. To take and go, take away; to take care of. --cu odxu. To take away, carry off. --uγad ire! Take and corne! Bring! γar taγan --xu.
